text: Labour in red, Liberal Democrats in yellow, Uncontested in cream. The 2015 Hull City Council election took place on 7 May 2015 to elect members of Hull City Council in England. This was on the same day as other local elections. One third of the council was up for election and Labour retained control of the council. After the election, the composition of the council was *Labour 40 *Liberal Democrat 15 *Conservative 2 *Hull Red Labour 1 *UK Independence 1 ==Ward results== No elections were held in Bricknell, St Andrews, Southcoates East and Southcoates West wards. ==References== Category:2015 English local elections Category:May 2015 events in the United Kingdom 2015 Category:2010s in Hull
title: 2015 Hull City Council election
